intro: Amblyanthera macrophylla, commonly known as the large-leaf amblyanthera, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is characterized by its broad, glossy leaves and clusters of small, white to pale pink flowers. The plant belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. It thrives in humid, tropical climates and is often found in moist forest understories. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for botanical gardens and private collections.
